simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: This definition must match the name used at startup by the cFE Executive Services when creating the HS application. Note that application names are also an argument to certain cFE commands. For example, the application name is needed to access tables via cFE Table Services commands.

simplesect.title: Limits:
simplesect.para: HS requires that this name be defined, but otherwise places no limits on the definition. Refer to CFE Executive Services for specific information on limits related to application names.

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: These parameters are used by CFE_ES_CreateChildTask Note that these values are only necessarily relevant in the default hs_custom.c.

simplesect.title: Limits:
simplesect.para: These limits will vary by platform and available resources.

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: This parameter is used to set the priority of the Idle Task. It should be higher than all other user created tasks, but may need to be set lower than the maximum value if an OS uses its own minimum priority task. Note that these values are only necessarily relevant in the default hs_custom.c.

simplesect.title: Limits:
simplesect.para: This parameter can't be larger than 255.

detaileddescription.para:
Description:
Maximum number of execution counters that can be specified to be reported in telemetry. Limits:
This parameter can't be larger than an unsigned 32 bit integer (4294967295). This parameter will dictate the size of the Execution Counter Table (XCT):
XCT Size = HS_MAX_EXEC_CNT_SLOTS * sizeof(HS_XCTEntry_t)
The total size of this table should not exceed the cFE size limit for a single buffered table set by the #CFE_TBL_MAX_SNGL_TABLE_SIZE parameter

Description:
Maximum number of Message Action action types. Limits:
This parameter can't be larger than 4 less than an unsigned 16 bit integer (65531). This parameter must be greater than 0.
This parameter will influence the size of the Message Action Table (MAT):
MAT Size = HS_MAX_MSG_ACT_TYPES * (HS_MAX_MSG_ACT_SIZE + 4)
The total size of this table should not exceed the cFE size limit for a single buffered table set by the #CFE_TBL_MAX_SNGL_TABLE_SIZE parameter

Description:
Size in bytes of maximum length of software bus message that can be sent using a Message Action action type. Limits:
This parameter can't be larger than CFE_SB_MAX_SB_MSG_SIZE This parameter can't be smaller than a packet header
This parameter will influence the size of the Message Action Table (MAT):
MAT Size = HS_MAX_MSG_ACT_TYPES * (HS_MAX_MSG_ACT_SIZE + 4)
The total size of this table should not exceed the cFE size limit for a single buffered table set by the #CFE_TBL_MAX_SNGL_TABLE_SIZE parameter

Description:
Maximum number of applications that can be monitored to assure check-ins Limits:
This parameter can't be larger than an unsigned 32 bit integer (4294967295). This parameter must be greater than 0.
This parameter will dictate the size of the Application Monitor Table (AMT):
AMT Size = HS_MAX_MONITORED_APPS * sizeof(HS_AMTEntry_t)
The total size of this table should not exceed the cFE size limit for a single buffered table set by the #CFE_TBL_MAX_SNGL_TABLE_SIZE parameter

Description:
Maximum number of events that can be monitored Limits:
This parameter can't be larger than an unsigned 32 bit integer (4294967295). This parameter must be greater than 0.
This parameter will dictate the size of the Event Monitor Table (EMT):
EMT Size = HS_MAX_MONITORED_EVENTS * sizeof(HS_EMTEntry_t)
The total size of this table should not exceed the cFE size limit for a single buffered table set by the #CFE_TBL_MAX_SNGL_TABLE_SIZE parameter

Description:
Number of milliseconds before a watchdog timeout occurs. Limits:
This parameter can't be larger than an unsigned 32 bit integer (4294967295). This parameter must be greater than 0.

xrefdescription.para: Time to wait after performing processing (in milliseconds)

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Dictates the length of a task delay performed prior to checking the Software Bus for a Wakeup Message. This ensures that HS will run no more often than a certain rate. If this parameter is set to 0, no task delay will be performed. Time is in milliseconds.

simplesect.title: Limits
simplesect.para: This parameter can't be larger than an unsigned 32 bit integer (4294967295).

detaileddescription.para:
Description:
This parameter is passed into CFE_SB_RcvMsg as the timeout value. It can specify CFE_SB_POLL, CFE_SB_PEND_FOREVER, or a timeout value in milliseconds. Limits
This Parameter must be CFE_SB_POLL, CFE_SB_PEND_FOREVER, or greater than 0 and less than 2^31 - 1 As a timeout, this parameter should be less than (HS_WATCHDOG_TIMEOUT_VALUE * 1000) - HS runtime in ms otherwise HS may not be able to service the watchdog in time.

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: String that is output to via OS_printf periodically if aliveness is enabled.

simplesect.title: Limits:
simplesect.para: None.

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Rate in number of HS cycles at which the HS_CPU_ALIVE_STRING is output via the UART.

simplesect.title: Limits:
simplesect.para: This parameter can't be larger than an unsigned 32 bit integer (4294967295).

xrefdescription.para: Max Number of Processor Resets that may be performed by HS

detaileddescription.para:
Description:
Maximum number of times that the HS App will attempt a processor reset as the result of either an Application Monitor or Event Monitor Failure Limits:
This parameter can't be larger than an unsigned 16 bit integer (65535). Although not enforced, if this parameter is greater than or equal to #CFE_ES_MAX_PROCESSOR_RESETS then a POWER-ON reset will occur before the max count is reached, resetting the remaining actions to the value set here.

Description:
Depth of the software bus pipe HS uses for commands and HK requests. Used during initialization in the call to CFE_SB_CreatePipe Limits:
This parameter can't be larger than #CFE_SB_MAX_PIPE_DEPTH This parameter must be greater than 0.

Description:
Depth of the software bus pipe HS uses for event monitoring. This should be set to supply sufficient room for the expected event message load per second. Used during initialization in the call to CFE_SB_CreatePipe Limits:
This parameter can't be larger than #CFE_SB_MAX_PIPE_DEPTH This parameter must be greater than 0.

Description:
Depth of the software bus pipe HS uses for wakeup messages. Used during initialization in the call to CFE_SB_CreatePipe Limits:
This parameter can't be larger than #CFE_SB_MAX_PIPE_DEPTH This parameter must be greater than 0.

xrefdescription.para: Time to wait before a processor reset (in milliseconds)

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Dictates the length of the task delay (milliseconds) performed prior to calling CFE_ES_ResetCFE to allow for any event message to go out.

simplesect.title: Limits
simplesect.para: This parameter can't be larger than an unsigned 32 bit integer (4294967295).

xrefdescription.para: Time to wait for all apps to be started (in milliseconds)

detaileddescription.para:
Description:
Dictates the timeout for the CFE_ES_WaitForStartupSync call that HS uses to wait for all of the Applications specified in the startup script to finish initialization. HS will wait this amount of time before assuming all startup script applications have been started and will then begin nominal processing. Limits
This parameter can't be larger than an unsigned 32 bit integer (4294967295). This should be greater than or equal to the Startup Sync timeout for any application in the Application Monitor Table.

xrefdescription.para: Default State of the Application Monitor

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: State the Application Monitor is set to when the HS application starts.

simplesect.title: Limits:
simplesect.para: Must be HS_STATE_ENABLED or HS_STATE_DISABLED

xrefdescription.para: Default State of the Event Monitor

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: State the Event Monitor is set to when the HS application starts.

simplesect.title: Limits:
simplesect.para: Must be HS_STATE_ENABLED or HS_STATE_DISABLED

xrefdescription.para: Default State of the Aliveness Indicator

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: State the Aliveness Indicator is set to when the HS application starts.

simplesect.title: Limits:
simplesect.para: Must be HS_STATE_ENABLED or HS_STATE_DISABLED

xrefdescription.para: Default State of the CPU Hogging Indicator

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: State the CPU Hogging Event Message is set to when the HS application starts.

simplesect.title: Limits:
simplesect.para: Must be HS_STATE_ENABLED or HS_STATE_DISABLED

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Default file to load the Applications Monitor Table from during a power-on reset sequence

simplesect.title: Limits:
simplesect.para: This string shouldn't be longer than #OS_MAX_PATH_LEN for the target platform in question

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Default file to load the Event Monitor Table from during a power-on reset sequence

simplesect.title: Limits:
simplesect.para: This string shouldn't be longer than #OS_MAX_PATH_LEN for the target platform in question

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Default file to load the Execution Counters Table from during a power-on reset sequence

simplesect.title: Limits:
simplesect.para: This string shouldn't be longer than #OS_MAX_PATH_LEN for the target platform in question

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Default file to load the Message Actions Table from during a power-on reset sequence

simplesect.title: Limits:
simplesect.para: This string shouldn't be longer than #OS_MAX_PATH_LEN for the target platform in question

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Number of times the Mark function must be called before it actually marks the time. This influences the interval size. The function calling the Mark function may not run at the same rate as the HS cycle (or HS may not want to monitor utilization every cycle) so this the interval to be at least as long as an HS cycle. Note that these values are only necessarily relevant in the default hs_custom.c.

simplesect.title: Limits:
simplesect.para: This parameter can't be larger than an unsigned 32 bit integer (4294967295).

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Number of HS Cycles it takes to complete a CPU Utilization Interval. HS will monitor the utilization after this number of HS wakeup cycles. Note that these values are only necessarily relevant in the default hs_custom.c.

simplesect.title: Limits:
simplesect.para: This parameter can't be larger than an unsigned 32 bit integer (4294967295).

xrefdescription.para: CPU Utilization Total Utils Per Interval

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Number of Utils (counts) equal to full utilization. This allows for higher resolution than percentages, and non decimal based values.

simplesect.title: Limits:
simplesect.para: This parameter can't be larger than an unsigned 32 bit integer (4294967295).

xrefdescription.para: CPU Utilization Hogging Utils Per Interval

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Number of Utils (counts) equal to utilization which is considered hogging during one interval. A greater number of counts is also considered hogging.

simplesect.title: Limits:
simplesect.para: This parameter can't be larger than HS_UTIL_PER_INTERVAL_TOTAL.

detaileddescription.para:
Description:
First multiplication conversion factor. Number of idle ticks is multiplied this value first when converting to utils. Note that these values are only necessarily relevant in the default hs_custom.c. Limits:
There may be processor dependent limits on value. Note that all math is done using "uint32" values; it is important that the number of loop iterations in HS_IDLE, times this value, not overflow. The result of the conversion must be a 32 bit signed integer (between -2147483648 and 2147483647).

Description:
Division conversion factor. Number of idle ticks is divided by this value after it has been multiplied by HS_UTIL_CONV_MULT1. Note that these values are only necessarily relevant in the default hs_custom.c. Limits:
There may be processor dependent limits on value. The result of the conversion must be a 32 bit signed integer (between -2147483648 and 2147483647).

Description:
Second multiplication conversion factor. Number of idle ticks is multiplied this value after being divided by HS_UTIL_CONV_DIV after being multiplied by HS_UTIL_CONV_MULT1 when converting to utils. Note that these values are only necessarily relevant in the default hs_custom.c. Limits:
There may be processor dependent limits on value. The result of the conversion must be a 32 bit signed integer (between -2147483648 and 2147483647).

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Number of intervals for which the hogging limit must be exceeded before hogging is reported.

simplesect.title: Limits:
simplesect.para: This parameter can't be larger than an unsigned 32 bit integer (4294967295).

xrefdescription.para: CPU Peak Utilization Number of Intervals

detaileddescription.para:
Description:
Number of intervals over which the peak utilization is determined. Limits:
This parameter can't be larger than an unsigned 32 bit integer (4294967295). This parameter controls the size of the array which stores previously measured utilization values.

xrefdescription.para: CPU Average Utilization Number of Intervals

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Number of intervals over which the average utilization is computed.

simplesect.title: Limits:
simplesect.para: This parameter can't be larger than HS_UTIL_PEAK_NUM_INTERVAL .

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Count mask for CPU Utilization Calibration. Time will be marked when (Counts & Mask) == Mask Note that these values are only necessarily relevant in the default hs_custom.c.

simplesect.title: Limits:
simplesect.para: This parameter can't be larger than an unsigned 32 bit integer (4294967295).

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Time will be marked into an array of subseconds. The independant parameter controls the exponent to which 2 is raised to determine the array size. As such, large values will require significant memory usage. Note that these values are only necessarily relevant in the default hs_custom.c.

simplesect.title: Limits:
simplesect.para: This parameter must be less than 32 and may not be negative.

xrefdescription.para: Mission specific version number for HS application

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: An application version number consists of four parts: major version number, minor version number, revision number and mission specific revision number. The mission specific revision number is defined here and the other parts are defined in "hs_version.h".

simplesect.title: Limits:
simplesect.para: Must be defined as a numeric value that is greater than or equal to zero.
